1: <sup>1</sup> Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.
2: <sup>2</sup> Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.
3: <sup>3</sup> For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.
4: <sup>4</sup> My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.
5: <sup>5</sup> By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.
6: <sup>6</sup> I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.
7: <sup>7</sup> I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
8: <sup>8</sup> Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.
9: <sup>9</sup> For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping.
10: <sup>10</sup> Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.
11: <sup>11</sup> My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.
12: <sup>12</sup> But thou, O LORD, shall endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.
13: <sup>13</sup> Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.
14: <sup>14</sup> For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.
15: <sup>15</sup> So the heathen shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.
16: <sup>16</sup> When the LORD shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.
17: <sup>17</sup> He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.
18: <sup>18</sup> This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.
19: <sup>19</sup> For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the LORD behold the earth;
20: <sup>20</sup> To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;
21: <sup>21</sup> To declare the name of the LORD in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;
22: <sup>22</sup> When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
23: <sup>23</sup> He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.
24: <sup>24</sup> I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.
25: <sup>25</sup> Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.
26: <sup>26</sup> They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:
27: <sup>27</sup> But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.
28: <sup>28</sup> The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.
